question:
In context of IAF recently retiring the MiG 27 attack aircraft, consider the following statements:
  1. It is also known as ‘Bahadur’.
  2. No country in the world currently uses this fighter aircraft.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The MiG 27 was originally designed by Mikoyan Gurevich design bureau of Soviet Union. It was later licensed and manufactured in India. In India, it is referred to as Bahadur, meaning Valiant. In December, Indian Air Force phased out the use of these fighter jets, following the MiG 23 BN and MiG 23 MF. Statement 2 is incorrect: Kazakhstan is the last remaining operator of the MiG after India phased it out in December. Other former operators include Ukraine, Sri Lanka and Russia. In India, the MiG 27 fighter jets featured prominently in the Kargil Conflict in 1999.
